messageBody:
I'll offer an amen to this one. I am using HSQLDB (it is no longer called HypersonicSQL, since it's change of owner/maintainer) in a small project that I am working on and have found that it plays well with both junit and ant and even struts (which is the thing that I am trying to learn! :-).

Through ant, I can run the SQL for table teardown and setup and, if I wish, populate the tables with known values from within the setup code. The in-memory features of HSQLDB are very useful for exactly what you are asking about.

From reading the message forums, it looks like the team are pushing for a 2.0 release with improved ACID features.

Simon

>Hypersonic SQL is a small, open source, pure Java, database with the
>possibility of setting up a database in memory.
>
>http://hsqldb.sourceforge.net/
>
>I would strongly recomend Hypersonic SQL for unit tests
>instead of writing a
>new one. Last time I looked, it did not support views, but it
>should be
>easier to add missing functionality to Hypersonic SQL than to
>create a new
>one.
>
>Lutris InstantDB was once planned as an open source product,
>but it seems
>from Lutris's site that those plans have been scrapped.
>
>Regards,
